(51) 1935th-July, 1951CABINETCOUNCIL OF EUROPE: PROTOCOL TO THE CONVENTION on human RIGHTSNote by the Secretary of State for Foreign affairs on 12th April, 1951, the Cabinet invited me to report on the proposed Protocolto the Convention on Human Rights adopted by the Council of Europe (CM. (5.1)27th Conclusions, Minute 3).2. I have delayed doing so in the hope that I might be able to submit recommendations, but although the Committee of Experts set up by the Councilof Europe to draft the Protocol (CP. (51) 10) have had a series of meetings sincethe beginning of the year they have not yet produced a final agreed text. It is clearthat further discussion will be required. I have requested the Secretary-General ofthe Council of Europe to arrange another meeting for mid-July. When a finalrevised text is produced it will be submitted to the Cabinet for consideration.H. M.Foreign Office, S.W. 1,5th July, 1951.40863
